reviews.title: Snug as a bug
reviews.text: Gud food, cosy,busy lil place in a cosy lil' town...jus dnt go 2 nightclub The Palace dwn the road!lol

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bar atmosphere good. Service in bar terrible. Ate in private function room. Food good. Service excellent, although forgot many basics like serviettes. Staff very attentive and pleasant. Food good although not as good as previous visits.
reviews.title: Over priced, over loud, over rated but not over big

reviews.text: Sadly let down by rooms. Paid £90 for room with only window looking out onto room across. Tiny room. Nicely decorated but bit shabby. In need of paint touch up.
reviews.title: sub standard meal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Noise from other rooms and from toilets too loud. Creaky floors, echoing of flushing pipes, very unpleasant nights sleep.
reviews.title: Very nice indeed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Refreshments not brilliant. 2 pots milk not sufficient although we could have asked for more. Cheap pack of biscuits. Bottles of water nice touch.
reviews.title: Gastropub with excellent bed and breakfast. Book it now

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Little Gem in the Cotswolds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was amazing, lots of traditional dishes with modern twists to appeal to all taste bubs. Good selection of wines which we enjoyed relaxing in the bar area on comfy leather sofa's. The staff were so helpful, friendly and professional and really made us feel welcome.
reviews.title: A pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a fair size with a lovely large round window and large bathroom (which was put to good use). The room had lovely comtemporary feel, gorgeous wall paper.
reviews.title: Could do better...

reviews.text: It was nice to get out of the city and relax in an welcoming environment......Well Done!
reviews.title: If you dont use The Fleece, you're mad!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night at the Fleece and found it quite charming. Although we had a terrible journey in appalling weather, the welcome we received made the trip worthwhile. The staff are all relatively young, with bags of enthusiasm which makes a nice change. Our room was at the front of the hotel and, although quite contemporary, could do with a coat of paint to freshen it up. This applies to the whole hotel which is very clean and well-decorated, but could do with a touch-up here and there. Not a criticism, but an observation. We had lunch in the bar which was a very good standard and equaled many restaurants for quality and innovation. Parking was a bit iffy as there was a function in the private dining room meaning the the car park was full, but I'm sure this was a one-off. Breakfast was good and freshly cooked. For the price of £90 per room I think it represents excellent value for the Cotswolds and we would heartily recommend to anyone who enjoys good food and service
reviews.title: Exceptional - apart from the bed!

reviews.text: Six of us stayed for a Saturday night in late November and really liked this place. It's more gastropub than spit and sawdust pub with interesting wallpaper, comfortable seating and convivial ambience. Service was friendly and attentive and we were offered mulled wine on checking in and when one of our party complained that there was no hairdryer or bath towels in their room we were later offered a round of drinks or reduction on the bill, which we thought was really good service - it was done in a friendly way and much appreciated. The bed was comfy with thick duvet, White Company cushions and throws and toiletries. The full english breakfast included in the £90 room rate was excellent in our opinion - they use good quality ingredients and cook them well. So all in all we agree with all the good reviews and would definitely stay there again, or just go there for dinner if in the area, and recommed it to others.
reviews.title: Stylish, comfortable and friendly gastropub hotel

reviews.text: Stayed just one night and this is a rare pub that I would recommend to others. A great atmosphere, food that lived up to its reputation, and a location right in the centre of Witney next to the village green. Nice people too, although service could have been quicker especially at breakfast.
reviews.title: Great pub, superb food, brilliant location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed on a Saturday night, bar and restaurant were very busy but service was very good - informal, friendly, quick and attentive. Breakfast and dinner food was of good gastropub standard and reasonably priced, as was the wine list. Good sized bedroom with modernised bathroom and view over Green. Overall good quality and real value for money. What could they do better? Some internal and external re-painting required plus action to address erratic shower hotwater temperatures during busy pre-breakfast period....(or advise guests to get up earlier!)
reviews.title: Lively gastropub with good rooms, good food, very good service = v/good value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just gopt back from a fab weekend at The Fleece in Witney. What a find! Gorgeous food and drink (although a few more real ales would be nice) and service you would expect from the best hotels in the world. Everybody from the cleaner to the bar staff to wiateresses to the manager were very freindly, welcoming, nothing too much trouble - bl**dy excellent!
reviews.title: Excellent food, excellent service - you simply can't go wrong!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great in a beautiful quite gree at one end of the twon but just a few mins walk from other resturants and pubs (not that uyou'd want to leave to be frank!).
reviews.title: A Rare Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A real gastro-pub with rooms. The food was exceptional, fresh seasonal ingredients, beautifully presented and great flavours. The rooms are individual, furnished in a modern style, well equipped, with nice toiletries, although being right over the pub could be a bit noisy until the crowds disperse. On Friday night the place is full of a young professionals "after work" crowd, it's busy so you will need to book. Thoroughly recommended for a weekend break on the edge of the Cotswolds.
reviews.title: Great food, lovely rooms, great atmosphere

reviews.text: On arrival at The Fleece we were shown to our room which was just opposite the restaurant ,we were a bit surprised to find the door opened directly into the room from the road to the car park.
reviews.title: No sleep Here !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had our 8 year old so it wasn t the ideal place for a family.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed our stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having visited friends in Witney we returned to the room to retire
reviews.title: Great restaurant, rooms tired, lacking attention to detail
